descriptors.A1: Can follow language which is very slow and carefully articulated, with long pauses for them to assimilate meaning.
descriptors.A2: Can understand phrases and expressions related to areas of most immediate priority (e.g. very basic personal and family information, shopping, local geography, employment), provided people articulate clearly and slowly.
descriptors.B1: Can understand the main points made in clear standard language on familiar matters regularly encountered at work, school, leisure, etc., including short narratives.
descriptors.B2: Can understand the main ideas of propositionally and linguistically complex discourse on both concrete and abstract topics delivered in standard language.
descriptors.C1: Can understand enough to follow extended discourse on abstract and complex topics beyond their own field, though they may need to confirm occasional details.
descriptors.C2: Can understand with ease virtually any kind of language, whether live or broadcast, delivered at fast natural speed.

descriptors.A1: Can understand words and short sentences in a simple conversation, provided people communicate very slowly and very clearly.
descriptors.A2: Can follow in outline short, simple social exchanges, conducted very slowly and clearly.
descriptors.B1: Can generally follow the main points of extended discussion around them, provided it is clearly articulated in standard language.
descriptors.B2: Can with some effort catch much of what is said around them in discussion.
descriptors.C1: Can easily follow complex interactions between third parties in group discussion and debate, even on abstract, complex, unfamiliar topics.
descriptors.C2: Can identify the sociocultural implications of most of the language used in colloquial discussions.

descriptors.A1: Can understand instructions addressed carefully and slowly to them and follow short, simple directions.
descriptors.A2: Can catch the main point in short, clear, simple messages and announcements.
descriptors.B1: Can understand simple technical information, such as operating instructions for everyday equipment.
descriptors.B2: Can understand announcements and messages on concrete and abstract topics delivered in standard language at normal speed.
descriptors.C1: Can extract specific information from poor quality, distorted public announcements.
descriptors.C2: No descriptors available; see C1.

descriptors.A1: Can understand very short, simple texts a single phrase at a time, picking up familiar names, words and basic phrases and rereading as required.
descriptors.A2: Can understand short, simple texts containing the highest frequency vocabulary, including a proportion of shared international vocabulary items.
descriptors.B1: Can read straightforward factual texts on subjects related to their field of interest with a satisfactory level of comprehension.
descriptors.B2: Can read with a large degree of independence, adapting style and speed of reading to different texts and purposes.
descriptors.C1: Can understand in detail lengthy, complex texts, whether or not these relate to their own area of speciality.
descriptors.C2: Can understand virtually all types of texts including abstract, structurally complex, or highly colloquial literary and non-literary writings.

descriptors.A1: Can understand short, simple messages on postcards and short messages sent via social media.
descriptors.A2: Can understand short, simple personal letters and very simple formal e-mails.
descriptors.B1: Can understand the description of events, feelings and wishes in personal letters well enough to correspond regularly.
descriptors.B2: Can read correspondence relating to their field of interest and readily grasp the essential meaning.
descriptors.C1: Can understand any correspondence given the occasional use of a dictionary.
descriptors.C2: Can understand specialised, formal correspondence on a complex topic.

descriptors.A1: Can get an idea of the content of simpler informational material and short, simple descriptions, especially if there is visual support.
descriptors.A2: Can understand texts describing people, places, everyday life and culture, provided they use simple language.
descriptors.B1: Can recognise significant points in straightforward news articles on familiar subjects.
descriptors.B2: Can understand articles and reports concerned with contemporary problems in which particular stances or viewpoints are adopted.
descriptors.C1: Can understand in detail a wide range of lengthy, complex texts likely to be encountered in social, professional or academic life.
descriptors.C2: Can understand the finer points and implications of a complex report or article even outside their area of specialisation.

descriptors.A1: Can follow short, simple written directions (e.g. to go from X to Y).
descriptors.A2: Can understand regulations, for example safety, when expressed in simple language.
descriptors.B1: Can understand clearly written, straightforward instructions for a piece of equipment.
descriptors.B2: Can understand lengthy, complex instructions in their field, including details on conditions and warnings.
descriptors.C1: Can understand in detail lengthy, complex instructions on a new machine or procedure.
descriptors.C2: No descriptors available; see C1.

descriptors.A1: Can produce simple, mainly isolated phrases about people and places.
descriptors.A2: Can give a simple description or presentation of people, living or working conditions, daily routines, likes/dislikes.
descriptors.B1: Can reasonably fluently sustain a straightforward description of one of a variety of subjects within their field of interest.
descriptors.B2: Can give clear, detailed descriptions and presentations on a wide range of subjects related to their field of interest.
descriptors.C1: Can give clear, detailed descriptions and presentations on complex subjects, integrating sub-themes and rounding off with an appropriate conclusion.
descriptors.C2: Can produce clear, smoothly flowing, well-structured discourse with an effective logical structure.

descriptors.A1: Can describe themselves, what they do and where they live.
descriptors.A2: Can describe their family, living conditions, educational background, present or most recent job.
descriptors.B1: Can give straightforward descriptions on a variety of familiar subjects within their field of interest.
descriptors.B2: Can give clear, detailed descriptions on a wide range of subjects related to their field of interest.
descriptors.C1: Can give clear, detailed descriptions of complex subjects, integrating sub-themes and rounding off with an appropriate conclusion.
descriptors.C2: Can give clear, smoothly flowing, elaborate and often memorable descriptions.

descriptors.A1: Can write simple isolated phrases and sentences.
descriptors.A2: Can write a series of simple phrases and sentences linked with simple connectors like 'and', 'but' and 'because'.
descriptors.B1: Can write straightforward connected texts on a range of familiar subjects within their field of interest.
descriptors.B2: Can write clear, detailed texts on a variety of subjects related to their field of interest, synthesising and evaluating information.
descriptors.C1: Can write clear, well-structured texts of complex subjects, underlining the relevant salient issues, expanding and supporting points of view.
descriptors.C2: Can write clear, smoothly flowing, complex texts in an appropriate and effective style.

descriptors.A1: Can write simple phrases and sentences about themselves and imaginary people, where they live and what they do.
descriptors.A2: Can write about everyday aspects of their environment in linked sentences.
descriptors.B1: Can write straightforward, detailed descriptions on a range of familiar subjects within their field of interest.
descriptors.B2: Can write clear, detailed descriptions of real or imaginary events and experiences.
descriptors.C1: Can write clear, detailed, well-structured and developed descriptions and imaginative texts in an assured, personal, natural style.
descriptors.C2: Can write clear, smoothly flowing, and fully engrossing stories and descriptions of experience in a style appropriate to the genre adopted.

descriptors.A1: Can interact in a simple way but communication is totally dependent on repetition at a slower rate, rephrasing and repair.
descriptors.A2: Can communicate in simple and routine tasks requiring a simple and direct exchange of information on familiar and routine matters.
descriptors.B1: Can exploit a wide range of simple language to deal with most situations likely to arise whilst travelling.
descriptors.B2: Can interact with a degree of fluency and spontaneity that makes regular interaction, and sustained relationships, quite possible.
descriptors.C1: Can express themselves fluently and spontaneously, almost effortlessly.
descriptors.C2: Has a good command of idiomatic expressions and colloquialisms with awareness of connotative levels of meaning.

descriptors.A1: Can take part in a simple conversation of a basic factual nature on a predictable topic.
descriptors.A2: Can handle very short social exchanges but is rarely able to understand enough to keep conversation going of their own accord.
descriptors.B1: Can enter unprepared into conversations on familiar topics.
descriptors.B2: Can engage in extended conversation on most general topics in a clearly participatory fashion.
descriptors.C1: Can use language flexibly and effectively for social purposes, including emotional, allusive and joking usage.
descriptors.C2: Can converse comfortably and appropriately, unhampered by any linguistic limitations.

descriptors.A1: No descriptors available.
descriptors.A2: Can discuss what to do, where to go and make arrangements to meet.
descriptors.B1: Can generally follow the main points in an informal discussion with friends.
descriptors.B2: Can take an active part in informal discussion in familiar contexts, commenting and putting a point of view clearly.
descriptors.C1: Can easily follow and contribute to complex interactions between third parties in group discussion.
descriptors.C2: Can advise on or discuss sensitive issues without awkwardness.

descriptors.A1: Can understand questions and instructions addressed carefully and slowly to them and follow short, simple directions.
descriptors.A2: Can understand enough to manage simple, routine tasks without undue effort.
descriptors.B1: Can follow what is being said, though they may occasionally have to ask for repetition if the other people's contributions are rapid.
descriptors.B2: Can understand detailed instructions reliably.
descriptors.C1: Can relate their own contribution skilfully to those of other speakers.
descriptors.C2: No descriptors available; see C1.

scales.scale: Transactions to obtain goods and services

descriptors.A1: Can ask people for things and give people things.
descriptors.A2: Can ask for and provide everyday goods and services.
descriptors.B1: Can deal with most transactions likely to arise whilst travelling, arranging travel or accommodation.
descriptors.B2: Can cope linguistically to negotiate a solution to a dispute like an undeserved fine.
descriptors.C1: Can express themselves with clarity and precision, using language flexibly and effectively.
descriptors.C2: No descriptors available; see C1.

descriptors.A1: Can understand questions and instructions addressed carefully and slowly and follow short, simple directions.
descriptors.A2: Can communicate in simple and routine tasks using simple phrases to ask for and provide things.
descriptors.B1: Can exchange, check and confirm accumulated factual information on familiar routine and non-routine matters.
descriptors.B2: Can understand and exchange complex information and advice on the full range of matters related to their occupational role.
descriptors.C1: Can easily follow and contribute to complex interactions between third parties in group discussion.
descriptors.C2: No descriptors available; see C1.

descriptors.A1: Can ask for or pass on personal details in written form.
descriptors.A2: Can write short, simple formulaic notes relating to matters of immediate need.
descriptors.B1: Can convey information and ideas on abstract as well as concrete topics, check information, and ask about or explain problems with reasonable precision.
descriptors.B2: Can express news and views effectively in writing, and relate to those of others.
descriptors.C1: Can express themselves with clarity and precision, relating to the addressee flexibly and effectively.
descriptors.C2: No descriptors available; see C1.

descriptors.A1: Has a very basic range of simple expressions about personal details and needs of a concrete type.
descriptors.A2: Has sufficient vocabulary for the expression of basic communicative needs and for coping with simple survival needs.
descriptors.B1: Has a sufficient vocabulary to express themselves with some circumlocutions on most topics pertinent to everyday life.
descriptors.B2: Has a good range of vocabulary for matters connected to their field and most general topics.
descriptors.C1: Has a good command of a broad lexical repertoire allowing gaps to be readily overcome with circumlocutions.
descriptors.C2: Has a good command of a very broad lexical repertoire including idiomatic expressions and colloquialisms.

descriptors.A1: No descriptors available.
descriptors.A2: Can control a narrow repertoire dealing with concrete everyday needs.
descriptors.B1: Shows good control of elementary vocabulary but major errors still occur when expressing more complex thoughts.
descriptors.B2: Lexical accuracy is generally high, though some confusion and incorrect word choice does occur without hindering communication.
descriptors.C1: Occasional minor slips, but no significant vocabulary errors.
descriptors.C2: Consistently correct and appropriate use of vocabulary.

descriptors.A1: Shows only limited control of a few simple grammatical structures and sentence patterns in a learnt repertoire.
descriptors.A2: Uses some simple structures correctly, but still systematically makes basic mistakes.
descriptors.B1: Communicates with reasonable accuracy in familiar contexts; generally good control though with noticeable mother tongue influence.
descriptors.B2: Shows a relatively high degree of grammatical control. Does not make mistakes which lead to misunderstanding.
descriptors.C1: Consistently maintains a high degree of grammatical accuracy; errors are rare and difficult to spot.
descriptors.C2: Maintains consistent grammatical control of complex language, even while attention is otherwise engaged.

descriptors.A1: Pronunciation of a very limited repertoire of learnt words and phrases can be understood with some effort by interlocutors used to dealing with speakers of the language group.
descriptors.A2: Pronunciation is generally clear enough to be understood, but conversational partners will need to ask for repetition from time to time.
descriptors.B1: Pronunciation is clearly intelligible even if a foreign accent is sometimes evident and occasional mispronunciations occur.
descriptors.B2: Has acquired a clear, natural pronunciation and intonation.
descriptors.C1: Can vary intonation and place sentence stress correctly in order to express finer shades of meaning.
descriptors.C2: Can articulate virtually all of the sounds of the target language with clarity and precision.

descriptors.A1: Can copy familiar words and short phrases, e.g. simple signs or instructions, names of everyday objects, names of shops.
descriptors.A2: Can copy short sentences on everyday subjects. Can write with reasonable phonetic accuracy short words that are in their oral vocabulary.
descriptors.B1: Can produce continuous writing which is generally intelligible throughout. Spelling, punctuation and layout are accurate enough to be followed most of the time.
descriptors.B2: Can produce clearly intelligible continuous writing which follows standard layout and paragraphing conventions.
descriptors.C1: Layout, paragraphing and punctuation are consistent and helpful. Spelling is accurate, apart from occasional slips.
descriptors.C2: Writing is orthographically free of error.

descriptors.A1: Can establish basic social contact by using the simplest everyday polite forms of greetings and farewells; introductions; saying please, thank you, sorry, etc.
descriptors.A2: Can handle very short social exchanges, using everyday polite forms of greeting and address.
descriptors.B1: Can perform and respond to a wide range of language functions, using their most common exponents in a neutral register.
descriptors.B2: Can express themselves confidently, clearly and politely in a formal or informal register, appropriate to the situation.
descriptors.C1: Can recognise a wide range of idiomatic expressions and colloquialisms, appreciating register shifts.
descriptors.C2: Has a good command of idiomatic expressions and colloquialisms with awareness of connotative levels of meaning.

descriptors.A1: No descriptors available.
descriptors.A2: Can adapt well-rehearsed memorised simple phrases to particular circumstances through limited lexical substitution.
descriptors.B1: Can adapt their expression to deal with less routine, even difficult situations.
descriptors.B2: Can adjust what they say and the means of expressing it to the situation and the recipient and adopt a level of formality appropriate to the circumstances.
descriptors.C1: Can modify their expression to express degrees of commitment or to highlight the focus of their communication.
descriptors.C2: Shows great flexibility reformulating ideas in differing linguistic forms to give emphasis, differentiate or to eliminate ambiguity.

descriptors.A1: Can link words or groups of words with very basic linear connectors like 'and' or 'then'.
descriptors.A2: Can link groups of words with simple connectors like 'and', 'but' and 'because'.
descriptors.B1: Can link a series of shorter, discrete simple elements into a connected, linear sequence of points.
descriptors.B2: Can use a variety of linking words efficiently to mark clearly the relationships between ideas.
descriptors.C1: Can produce clear, smoothly flowing, well-structured text, showing controlled use of organisational patterns, connectors and cohesive devices.
descriptors.C2: Can create coherent and cohesive text making full and appropriate use of a variety of organisational patterns.
